STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 26, 2022
Christine Brail
Keane Center For Adoption
930 Mason
Dearborn, MI 48124
RE: License #: CB820201219
Keane Center For Adoption
933 N. Melborn
Dearborn, MI 48128
Dear Mrs. Brail:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 1/14/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 860--0787.
Sincerely,
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Lonia Perry, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3317
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12605
Adoptive family evaluation.
(3) The report shall be an assessment of all of the
following:
(a) Visits at the residence of the applicants for adoption
to conduct observations of, and interviews with, each
member of the household to determine all of the following:
(ix) Strengths and weaknesses of each member of the
household.
Three of seven adoptive family assessments reviewed did not
show compliance:
 One family adoption assessment did not show
documentation of the worker’s assessment of the
applicants’ strengths and weaknesses.
 A second did not show documentation of the worker’s
assessment of the applicants’ two children’s strengths
and weaknesses.
 A third did not show documentation of the worker’s
assessment of the applicants’ weaknesses.
Technical Assistance:
The agency is apprised the family’s adoption assessment shall
consistently include what the worker assesses; as well as
consistently include an interview and or observation of all
household members, inclusive of children who live in the home
part-time.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
None
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
4

included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
Not applicable; this is not a contractual agency.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
As indicated earlier in this report.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R40012712(1) Supervision
The agency is advised adding the headings, date of placement and post
placement home visit date(s), to its Post Placement report, denoting similar
aforementioned stated language, may aid it is showing clearer compliance to
the rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2020 Renewal Inspection where it
received the following rule violations:
 R400.12203(1)(e) for Financial stability, related to an annual financial audit.
 R400.12212(2) (e)(i) for Personnel records, related to state criminal record
clearances.
The agency obtained a variance from the Division of Child Welfare Licensing related
to R400.12203(1)(e). It remains in compliance with the corrective action plan for
personnel records.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
